title: Why does everyone hate heavy metal? - Quora

response.answer_text: The premise is false, but I’ll answer it as if the question is asking about the genre’s limited exposure in the mainstream, which is also not exactly true, but not as egregiously inaccurate. You can’t passively listen to metal. Fully appreciating it requires an understanding of musical complexity and a respect for artistic exploration beyond the confines of the generic. The mentality of ’sticking it to the man’ continues to be a major driving force in the genre, and its seen as one of its greatest charms. That said, such an emphasis on individual expression means much of what’s produced bewilders the casual listener. Metal is a huge genre. That means there are many metalheads out there who are insufferably snobbish and pretentious about their tastes. Like all other major industries, there is a fair amount of douchebaggery. Of course, it would be irrational to dislike a whole genre of music simply for having one obnoxious friend who identifies with it. Some people have no desire to listen to challenging music.Nothing wrong with that. I say it would behoove us metalheads to be less pompous about our tastes.
